poem:
**An American Pope**

From Chicago streets to ancient Rome,  
Pope Leo XIV takes up the throne.  
White smoke drifts through Michelangelo's air,  
as pilgrims cheer beneath St. Peter's glare.  
In 69 years, what dreams unfold,  
when a child from the Midwest  
wears a papal robe of white and gold?
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Share your views on Pope Leo XIV Robert Francis Prevost, from Chicago, has become the first American pope to lead the Roman Catholic church. The 69-year-old has taken the papal name Pope Leo XIV, a senior cardinal announced from the central balcony of St Peter’s Basilica on Thursday evening. The announcement, which followed white smoke billowing from the chimney above the Sistine Chapel, prompted raucous celebration among the 50,000 pilgrims and tourists in St Peter’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
